title: For Bourne, the new Sagamore Bridge takings echo a long past
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: The state of Massachusetts plans to acquire and demolish 13 homes in Bourne to build the new Sagamore Bridge.
Bourne has a history of land takings due to projects like the Cape Cod Canal and Massachusetts Maritime Academy.
Residents facing displacement from the Sagamore Bridge construction contend with fair market value disputes for their homes.

title: ‘It’s a joke’: David Pastrnak, Bruins vent after controversial OT call in Stadium Series
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: David Pastrnak criticizes a controversial penalty call after scoring a potential overtime goal against the Tampa Bay Lightning.
The Bruins lost 6-5 in a shootout after the goal was disallowed and Pastrnak was penalized for slashing.
Bruins players expressed frustration about the lack of penalty calls against Tampa Bay during the game.

title: 11 takeaways from Bruins’ wild shootout loss to Lightning in Stadium Series
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins lost 6-5 in a shootout to the Tampa Bay Lightning in the Stadium Series at Raymond James Stadium.
Boston controlled play initially, leading 5-1, but Tampa Bay surged back with three power-play goals to tie the game.
Conditions were unexpectedly cold at 41.8°F, colder than the 2023 Winter Classic, affecting ice quality at the outdoor game.

title: Former dairy farm in Dartmouth converted to $2M luxury home
author: Megan Johnson
bullets: A former dairy farm in Dartmouth, Massachusetts, has been transformed into a 7,891-square-foot luxury home.
The property includes four bedrooms, six bathrooms, and is listed for nearly $2 million.
Features include a massive double-sided stone fireplace, exposed beams, and a smart home system with solar panels.

title: Active-duty Boston police officer dies after more than 30 years with department, BPD says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Boston Police Officer Scott MacIsaac has died after being diagnosed with cancer in 2025, according to a GoFundMe organizer.
MacIsaac joined the Boston Police Department in 1995, serving in West Roxbury and other districts, and is survived by his family.
MacIsaac was commended for his role during the Boston Marathon bombings and other humanitarian efforts, BPD stated.

title: Bruins’ Jeremy Swayman gets into goalie fight with Andrei Vasilevskiy in outdoor game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Jeremy Swayman and Lightning's Andrei Vasilevskiy fought in front of 64,000 fans during Sunday's outdoor NHL game.
Both goalies received minor and major penalties but remained in the game, which ended in a Bruins' 6-5 shootout loss.
This was Swayman's first professional fight, earning praise despite the Bruins' shootout loss to Tampa Bay Lightning.

title: Suspect charged with murder after mother and son shot to death in Fall River
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Arlington Cole, 54, charged with two counts of murder and firearm possession in Fall River shootings.
Victims Elizabeth, 54, and Nicholas Almedia, 25, were fatally shot; they were mother and son.
Cole, found at scene, was in a relationship with Elizabeth Almedia; arraignment set for Monday.

title: Dozens rescued by N.H. fire officials after ski lift malfunctions in bitter cold
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nearly 60 skiers were rescued from a malfunctioning ski lift at Dartmouth Skiway in New Hampshire.
Lyme, Hanover, and Thetford fire departments worked together to complete the rescue in under 90 minutes.
One skier was taken to Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center; others warmed up at the lodge with no reported injuries.

title: Former Mass. state senator receives more prison time for fraud
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Mass. State Sen. Dean Tran sentenced to an additional 11 months for obstruction of justice and false statements.
Ten months of Tran's new sentence will run concurrently with his existing 18-month sentence; he will serve one extra month.
Tran previously sentenced for fraudulently collecting pandemic unemployment benefits and omitting income in 2020-2022 tax returns.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month after scoring eight goals in January.
Minten led all rookies with 14 points, contributing to Boston's 11-2-1 record in January.
Bruins acquired 21-year-old Minten from Maple Leafs at last year's trade deadline.
